definitions: Caused (an event or situation, typically one that is bad or undesirable) to happen suddenly, unexpectedly, or prematurely.
Caused (a substance) to be deposited in solid form from a solution.
Threw (someone or something) headlong from a great height.
examples: The crisis was precipitated by a lack of funding.
The salt precipitated out of the solution.
He precipitated himself down the stairs.
